byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED and REED ABELSON

abstract: Cigna's rejection of Anthem's $47 billion takeover bid is latest in series of merger maneuvers in health insurance industry prompted by Affordable Care Act; major insurance companies are seeking to capitalize on areas of growth that have opened up due to fact that Medicare and Medicaid are increasingly turning to private plans to provide coverage.
lead_paragraph: Anthem’s $47 billion takeover bid for Cigna comes as companies look to become even bigger to take advantage of the changes in the health insurance market.

headline.main: Cigna Rejects an Overture From Anthem
headline.print_headline: Cigna Rejects an Overture From Anthem

snippet: Anthem’s $47 billion takeover bid for Cigna comes as companies look to become even bigger to take advantage of the changes in the health insurance market.
